item.title: Vilja add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Vilja add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Vilja add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Vilja add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: Vilja add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Vilja add a quote by Gordon A. Eadie
item.description: "If you don't stand for something you will fall for anything." -- Gordon A. Eadie

item.title: Vilja add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Vilja add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "I generally avoid temptation unless I can't resist it." -- Mae West

item.title: Vilja add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "I'll try anything once, twice if I like it, three times to make sure." -- Mae West

item.title: Vilja add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "Marriage is a fine institution, but I'm not ready for an institution." -- Mae West

item.title: Vilja add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "To err is human - but it feels divine." -- Mae West

item.title: Vilja add a quote by Mae West
item.description:
"JUDGE: Are you trying to show contempt for this court?
MAE WEST: I was doin' my best to hide it." -- Mae West

item.title: Vilja add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "All discarded lovers should be given a second chance, but with somebody else." -- Mae West

item.title: Vilja add a quote by Malcolm X
item.description: "You're not to be so blind with patriotism that you can't face reality. Wrong is wrong, no matter who does it or says it." -- Malcolm X

item.title: Vilja add a quote by Malcolm X
item.description: "If you have no critics you'll likely have no success. " -- Malcolm X

item.title: Vilja add a quote by Malcolm X
item.description: "The ability to read awoke inside of me some long dormant craving to be mentally alive." -- Malcolm X

item.title: Vilja add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "In the end, we will remember not the words of our enemies, but the silence of our friends." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Vilja add a quote by Robert Anton Wilson
item.description: "belief is the death of intelligence." -- Robert Anton Wilson

item.title: Vilja add a quote by Robert Anton Wilson
item.description: "The Bible tells us to be like God, and then on page after page it describes God as a mass murderer. This may be the single most important key to the political behavior of Western Civilization." -- Robert Anton Wilson

item.title: Vilja add a quote by Robert Anton Wilson
item.description: "...an optimistic mind-set finds dozens of possible solutions for every problem that the pessimist regards as incurable." -- Robert Anton Wilson

item.title: Vilja add a quote by Robert Anton Wilson
item.description: "...reality is always plural and mutable." -- Robert Anton Wilson

item.title: Vilja add a quote by Robert Anton Wilson
item.description: "I don't believe anything, but I have many suspicions." -- Robert Anton Wilson

item.title: Vilja add a quote by Robert Anton Wilson
item.description: "Human beings live in their myths. They only endure their realities." -- Robert Anton Wilson

item.title: Vilja add a quote by Robert Anton Wilson
item.description: "It only takes 20 years for a liberal to become a conservative without changing a single idea." -- Robert Anton Wilson

item.title: Vilja add a quote by Robert Anton Wilson
item.description: "Horror is the natural reaction to the last 5,000 years of history." -- Robert Anton Wilson

item.title: Vilja add a quote by Robert Anton Wilson
item.description: "Is," "is," "is"—the idiocy of the word haunts me. If it were abolished, human thought might begin to make sense. I don't know what anything "is"; I only know how it </i>seems to me at this moment</i>." -- Robert Anton Wilson

item.title: Vilja add a quote by Robert Anton Wilson
item.description: "Existence is larger than any model that is not itself the exact size of existence...." -- Robert Anton Wilson

item.title: Vilja add a quote by Robert Anton Wilson
item.description: "Taxation is robbery based on monopoly of weapons" -- Robert Anton Wilson

item.title: Vilja add a quote by Robert Anton Wilson
item.description: "We have been told over and over that "you can't change human nature", but the study of emic realities shows quite the contrary, that almost anything can become "human nature" if society defines it as such." -- Robert Anton Wilson

item.title: Vilja add a quote by Robert Anton Wilson
item.description: "Having a spine is overrated. If everybody squealed and ran away, there'd be no more wars." -- Robert Anton Wilson
